title: Spin Master Issues 2022 Corporate Social Responsibility Report and Releases Climate Action Plan - PR Newswire
summary: Spin Master Corp. issued its fourth annual Corporate Social Responsibility report, detailing the company's performance and targets in several key areas such as environment, products, people, and communities. The report includes achievements like emissions reductions, waste reduction targets, sustainable product launches, gender pay equity, and increased philanthropic giving. Spin Master's CSR vision focuses on creating magical play experiences while being custodians of the environment for the future generations.

title: LyondellBasell Details Accelerated Momentum in 2022 Sustainability Report - LyondellBasell

LyondellBasell also focused on safety, diversity, and community engagement.

title: California approves rule phasing out big diesel trucks - CBS Sacramento
summary: California has approved new rules to ban the sale of diesel big rigs and buses by 2036 as part of efforts to combat climate change and promote cleaner air. The state aims to phase out diesel-powered vehicles and transition to zero-emission technologies, impacting the transportation sector and reducing greenhouse gas emissions. The rules also include transitioning away from diesel locomotives and adopting more zero-emission technologies for trains transporting goods. The article highlights concerns from the trucking industry about the feasibility and costs of transitioning to zero-emission vehicles.
green_innovation: TRUE. This is green innovation as it involves the introduction of new rules and technologies to reduce environmental impacts, combat climate change, and promote sustainability in the transportation sector.
business_innovation: FALSE. This is not specifically a business innovation, as the focus is on regulatory changes and technological advancements in the transportation sector rather than on new products or processes introduced by a firm.
green_product: FALSE. The article does not focus on a specific product but rather on regulatory changes and transitioning to zero-emission technologies in the transportation sector.
green_process: TRUE. The article discusses transitioning to green processes in the transportation sector by phasing out diesel-powered vehicles and adopting more zero-emission technologies to reduce environmental impacts.
